title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.6 - Permit valid for one transaction only
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.6 - Permit valid for one transaction only

State Regulations
(a) With the exception of annual permits issued under subdivisions (b), (c), (e), or (j) [of section
99-b
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law]
which are effective for a calendar year, each permit under this section shall
be valid for one transaction only. A transaction under a particular permit is
meant to include a purchase or sale, as the case may be, from or to one or more
licensees at the same time. (b) A
separate permit must be obtained for each trip of the particular vessel or
aircraft for which alcoholic beverages are purchased and delivered. (c) A separate permit must be obtained for
each delivery of liquor, wine or beer to the premises of the manufacturer of
non-beverage products. (d) A
separate permit must be obtained on each execution or court order for the sale
of alcoholic beverages by a marshal, sheriff, trustee or receiver, etc., made
pursuant to court order. (e) A
separate permit must be obtained by an out-of-state manufacturer or wholesaler
for each wholesaler in this State with whom a contract is to be
negotiated. (f) A separate permit
must be obtained by a bank to sell warehouse receipts, as the result of the
default in repayment of a loan, on each loan to a licensee. (g) A separate permit must be obtained by a
fire insurance or fire salvage company to sell alcoholic beverages in its
possession, for each licensed premises on which a fire occurred. (h) A separate permit must be obtained by a
warehouseman, steamship company, etc., to sell alcoholic beverages on which it
has acquired a lien by statute, for each lien so acquired. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
33.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
